alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Northwest Carter; Sullivan; Washington (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sullivan, northeastern Washington, northwestern Johnson, northwestern Carter and Washington Counties and the City of Bristol through 515 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Whitetop to Johnson City. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Johnson City, Bristol Tn, Bristol Va, Elizabethton, Abingdon, Jonesborough, Central, Midway, Walnut Hill and Oak Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
